meanings.definition: A class of chemical compounds found in plants that have soap-like properties.
meanings.sent1: Some plants produce saponins that can create a soapy effect.
meanings.sent2: When mixed with water, certain plants release saponins that foam like soap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf sprinkled saponins in the pond, causing bubbles to form everywhere!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like saponins in a washing machine, infectious and frothy.
meanings.sent5: The saponins in the plant made it a natural cleanser, perfect for washing hands in the wild.

meanings.definition: Any of various plant glycosides that form soapy lathers when mixed and agitated with water.
meanings.sent1: Agitating water with certain plants releases saponins that create a soapy lather.
meanings.sent2: The herbal shampoo contains saponins that produce a rich lather when used.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon accidentally spilled saponins in the river, turning it into a giant bubble bath!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like saponins, creating a foamy mess of emotions in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The saponins in the soapwort plant made it a popular choice for natural cleaning products.
